results.title: Don't move = Non ti muovere
results.creator_credit: Sergio Castellitto, Giovanni Stabilini, Marco Chimenz, Riccardo Tozzi, Cattleya and Medusa Film
results.brief_description: As his teenage daughter’s life hangs in the balance, a surgeon recalls crucial moments of his life, including an angst-ridden affair with a marginalised Albanian woman (a seriously de-glamorised Penelope Cruz) who he raped, but subsequently became sexually and emotionally entangled with. Adapted from the best-selling novel by Margaret Mazzantini, Castellitto (who also wrote the screenplay and previously directed the charming drama “Mostly Martha”) presents an unflattering view of male anguish, betrayal and brutality as Timoteo becomes conflicted by his double life as an urbane husband on the one hand and a violent lover to a troubled waif, living in abject conditions, on the other.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sergio Castellitto, Giovanni Stabilini, Marco Chimenz, Riccardo Tozzi, Cattleya and Medusa Film

results.title: Don't knock the ox
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The International Ox Pull, highlight of the Bridgewater, Nova Scotia, annual fair, is a holdover from the pioneer past when oxen cleared the land and tilled the soil. That these great beasts of burden have lost none of their pulling power is well demonstrated as they drag tons of weight loaded on sleds (the winner pulls up to six tons). Competing teams come from various parts of the Maritimes and the northeastern United States.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ianzelo, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Perfect strangers
results.creator_credit: Stephen Poliakoff, John Chapman and BBC
results.brief_description: A drama with family, immigration and belonging the main themes. With a dreamy and slow atmosphere, this family history story unfolds with the use of family photographs as story telling tools. It’s a moving series about relationships and ancestors, history and reunion. Cast includes Michael Gambon and Lindsay Duncan.

results.title: Domestic Play (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ann Sharp, Kathleen Manning, Drake Educational Associates and Video Lock Educational
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School No.2”.
Identifies the different kinds of teacher involvement in domestic play. Domestic play includes mothers and fathers, dolls, shopping, cooking, cleaning, washing, furnishing the house, and hospitals

results.title: Playing Outdoors (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School No.6”.
This tape covers all the categories of play shown in the other tapes in the series taken outdoors. It discusses the advantages and problems for both teachers and children of taking play outside

results.title: Play with Natural Materials (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School No.5”.
Children’s play with natural materials appears to be divided into sensory, imaginative and exploratory play. Shows teachers harnessing the fascination that natural materials have for young children

results.title: Construction Play (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ann Sharp, Kathleen Manning, Drake Educational Associates and Ward Lock Educational
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School No.3”.
Shows the different kinds of stimuli that are the basis of the children’s play. Construction play covers play with large and small building material both manufactured and improvised; sometimes these are combined with other materials e.g. sand

results.title: Doing time
results.creator_credit: Bruno Boulianne, Eric Michel, National Film Board of Canada and Society and Science Studio
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the experiences of a group of inmates in Bordeaux Jail who are participants in the radio show, Souverains anonymes. Under the guidance of Mohamed Lotfi the inmates are given an opportunity to express themselves in regular studio activities where their need to be heard, catalysed by the jail environment and their experiences before and during their imprisonment, is nurtured and given form through words. A portrait of daily prison life and the inmates that participate in Lotfi’s program, a varied, sometimes tragic, sometimes hopeful picture of prison life and the circumstances that brought each person there is evoked. Through interviews with inmates, footage of the studio sessions and interviews with Lotfi and professional guests to the program this documentary investigates the drive for and discovery of freedom through language and the release of personal expression.

results.title: Dogwatch
results.creator_credit: Laurie McInnes, Richard Brennan, AFFC, Black Ray Films and Smile Production
results.brief_description: From the director of “Broken Highway”, “Dogwatch” is a thriller set at sea aboard a rusty cargo ship with equally as dubious a crew. Captained by alcoholic and corrupt skipper (Steven Vidler) aka ‘The Judas Captain’, the doomed ship is to be sunk by Heckle, the first mate (John Brumpton) once the captain has navigated the vessel to deep waters - all paid for by Triad gangsters. The hapless (sometimes farcical) crew and mysteriously cryptic Palmer (Russell Kiefel) make the journey unbearable for the captain. Stopping off to do a bit of gun smuggling in exchange for gold, the crew discover a stench in the hold and as one crew member points out ‘The Triad’ that organised this cruise won’t be expecting anyone to return. Mutiny and murder take over the minds of the crew as each man tries to assert his will and survive the situation in which they find themselves. Written and directed by Laurie McInnes. Cast includes Richard Carter, Joel Edgerton, John Alansu, Yaw Glymin.
